bundesliga.model.pyro package

pyro_model

Module: pyro_model.py

Summary:

Base class for Pyro-based probabilistic models to predict football match outcomes.

Dependencies:

  • numpy as np

  • pandas as pd

  • pyro

  • pyro.infer

  • pyro.optim

  • bundesliga.settings

  • bundesliga.model.base_footballmodel.FootballModel

class bundesliga.model.pyro.pyro_model.PyroModel(team_lexicon: DataFrame, model_options: dict)

Bases: FootballModel

A base class for Pyro-based probabilistic models to predict football match outcomes.

This class provides the foundational structure for training and predicting using Pyro, a probabilistic programming framework built on PyTorch. It includes methods for training the model, calculating win probabilities, and validating predictions.

team_lexicon

A mapping of team identifiers to team names or indices used within the model.

Type:

dict

model_config

Configuration parameters for the model.

Type:

dict

sampler_config

Configuration parameters for the sampler.

Type:

dict

get_probs_winner_from_goal_results(goals_of_team_1: array, goals_of_team_2: array) → array

Calculates the probabilities of team 1 winning, team 2 winning, or a draw based on goal results.

Parameters:

  • goals_of_team_1 (np.array) – Goals scored by team 1.

  • goals_of_team_2 (np.array) – Goals scored by team 2.

Returns:

An array containing probabilities for home-team win, away-team win, and draw.

Return type:

np.array

predict_toto_probabilities(predictions: DataFrame, **kwargs) → array

Predicts the probabilities for match outcomes (toto) based on predicted goals.

Parameters:

  • predictions (pd.DataFrame) – A dictionary containing predicted home and away goals.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:

An array containing the predicted probabilities for match outcomes.

Return type:

np.array

train(X: DataFrame, y: DataFrame, **kwargs) → list

Trains the PyroModel using the provided data.

Parameters:

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – Input data containing home and away team IDs.

  • y (pd.DataFrame) – Target data containing home goals, away goals, and match results (toto).

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for training.

Returns:

A list of losses during training.

Return type:

list

pyro_parameters

class bundesliga.model.pyro.pyro_parameters.FootballParameters(nb_teams, prior_diff)

Bases: Module

pyro_simple_model

class bundesliga.model.pyro.pyro_simple_model.SimplePyroModel(team_lexicon, parameters, prior_diff=0.4054651081081644)

Bases: PyroModel

A simple Pyro-based model for predicting football match outcomes.

This model extends the PyroModel class and implements a basic probabilistic model for predicting goals and match results. It uses Normal distributions for team strengths and Poisson distributions for goal predictions.

prior_diff

A prior value for the difference in team offensive strengths.

Type:

float

get_diffs(team_1, team_2, num_games=10000)

Calculates the differences in offensive and defensive strengths between two teams.

Parameters:

  • team_1 (int) – The ID of the first team.

  • team_2 (int) – The ID of the second team.

  • num_games (int) – The number of simulations to run (default: 10000).

Returns:

Two arrays containing the differences in offensive and defensive strengths.

Return type:

tuple

get_guide() → callable

Defines the guide (variational distribution) for variational inference.

Returns:

A function representing the Pyro guide.

Return type:

function

get_model() → callable

Defines the probabilistic model for team offensive and defensive strengths.

Returns:

A function representing the Pyro model.

Predicts the goals scored by home and away teams based on test data.

Parameters:

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:
